post.description: Fetches fungible tokens (native and ERC-20) for multiple wallet addresses and networks. Returns a list of tokens with balances, prices, and metadata for each wallet/network combination. This endpoint is supported on Ethereum, Solana, and 30+ EVM chains. See the full list of supported networks [here](https://dashboard.alchemy.com/chains?service=token-api&utm_source=readme&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=docs_method_chains_link_v1_tokens).

schema.description: For higher throughput, create your own API key

addresses.description: Array of address and networks pairs (limit 2 pairs, max 5 networks each). Networks should match network enums.

networks.description: Network identifier (e.g., eth-mainnet). Find more network enums here

withMetadata.description: Boolean - if set to `true`, returns metadata. Setting this to false will reduce payload size and may result in a faster API call. Defaults to `true`.

withPrices.description: Boolean - if set to `true`, returns token prices. Setting this to false will reduce payload size and may result in a faster API call. Defaults to `true`.

includeNativeTokens.description: Whether to include each chain's native token in the response (e.g. ETH on Ethereum). The native token will have a null contract address.

data.description: List of tokens by address, with prices and metadata.

params.description: string, 20 Bytes - Singular address for the token contract.

lastUpdatedAt.description: Time when the price was last updated.

400.description: Bad Request: Invalid input (e.g., malformed JSON).

429.description: Too Many Requests: Rate limit exceeded.

post.description: Fetches fungible tokens (native and ERC-20) for multiple wallet addresses and networks. Returns a list of tokens with balances for each wallet/network combination. This endpoint is supported on Ethereum, Solana, and 30+ EVM chains. See the full list of supported networks [here](https://dashboard.alchemy.com/chains?service=token-api&utm_source=readme&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=docs_method_chains_link_v1_tokens)

post.description: Fetches NFTs for multiple wallet addresses and networks. Returns a list of NFTs and metadata for each wallet/network combination. This endpoint is supported on Ethereum and many L2s, including Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, World Chain and more. See the full list of supported networks [here](https://dashboard.alchemy.com/chains?service=token-api&utm_source=readme&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=docs_method_chains_link_v1_tokens).

addresses.description: Array of address and networks pairs (limit 2 pairs, max 15 networks each). Networks should match network enums.

withMetadata.description: Boolean - if set to `true`, returns metadata. Setting this to false will reduce payload size and may result in a faster API call. Defaults to `true`.

data.description: List of nfts by address with appropriate metadata.

post.description: Fetches NFT collections (contracts) for multiple wallet addresses and networks. Returns a list of collections and metadata for each wallet/network combination. This endpoint is supported on Ethereum and many L2s, including Polygon, Arbitrum, Optimism, Base, World Chain and more. See the full list of supported networks [here](https://dashboard.alchemy.com/chains?service=token-api&utm_source=readme&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=docs_method_chains_link_v1_tokens).

post.description: Fetches all historical transactions (internal & external) for multiple wallet addresses and networks. Returns a list of transaction objects with metadata and log information. This endpoint will be supported on Ethereum, Solana, and 30+ EVM chains (Beta: currently limited to Ethereum and Base with a limit of 1 address)

schema.description: For higher throughput, create your own API key

addresses.description: Array of address and networks pairs (limit 1 pairs, max 2 networks). Networks should match network enums.

networks.description: (In BETA and only accepts ETH & BASE mainnets). Network identifier (e.g., eth-mainnet). Find more network enums here

limit.description: Sets the maximum number of items per page (Max: 100)

totalCount.description: Total count of the response items.

network.description: Network associated with an individual transaction

blockNumber.description: Block number of transaction mining / confirmation

blockHash.description: Block hash of transaction mining / confirmation

transactionIndex.description: Position of transaction within a block

toAddress.description: To address of transaction (hex string). null if contract creation.

contractAddress.description: 20 Bytes - The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null

value.description: (uint8) Value of native token value moved within the external transaction

cumulativeGasUsed.description: The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.

gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used by this specific transaction alone

logs.description: Array of log objects, which this transaction generated

contractAddress.description: 20 Bytes - contract address from which this log originated.

logIndex.description: Integer of the log index position in the block. null when its pending log.

data.description: Contains one or more 32 Bytes non-indexed arguments of the log.

removed.description: true when the log was removed, due to a chain reorganization. false if its a valid log.

topics.description: Array of zero to four 32 Bytes DATA of indexed log arguments

internalTxns.description: Array of internal transaction objects, which this transaction generated

toAddress.description: 20 Bytes - address of the receiver. null when its a contract creation transaction

value.description: amount of value for transfer (in hex)

gas.description: amount of gas provided for the call (in hex)

get.description: Fetches the first block before or after a given timestamp. Returns the block's number and on-chain timestamp.

schema.description: For higher throughput, create your own API key

parameters.name: networks
parameters.description: Array of networks to query on. The response will be an array with one block per network. Find network enums here

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Return the first block "BEFORE" or "AFTER" the provided timestamp

400.description: Bad Request: Malformed request or missing parameters.

429.description: Too Many Requests: Rate limit exceeded.

raw.description: Raw details of the NFT like its tokenUri and metadata info obtained directly from the smart contract

tokenUri.description: String - Uri representing the location of the NFT's original metadata blob. This is a backup for you to parse when the metadata field is not automatically populated.

metadata.description: Relevant metadata for NFT contract. This is useful for viewing image url, traits, etc. without having to follow the metadata url in tokenUri to parse manually.

image.description: String - URL to the NFT asset image. Can be standard URLs pointing to images on conventional servers, IPFS, or Arweave. Most types of images (SVGs, PNGs, JPEGs, etc.) are supported by NFT marketplaces.

name.description: String - Name of the NFT asset.

description.description: String - Human-readable description of the NFT asset. (Markdown is supported/rendered on OpenSea and other NFT platforms)

attributes.description: Object - Traits/attributes/characteristics for each NFT asset.

error.description: String - A string describing a particular reason that we were unable to fetch complete metadata for the NFT.

externalUrl.description: String - URL for the external site of the collection
